body:
July 12 (Reuters) - Banc of America Securities raised its second-quarter sales and earnings estimates for Intel Corp. (INTC.O), saying the brokerage’s checks suggested second-quarter sales were above the mid-point of the chipmaker’s outlook.

The brokerage, which also raised its price target on the stock to $29 from $28, said it sees solid demand for the company’s Merom family of processors.

Banc of America now expects the company to earn 21 cents a share on sales of $8.7 billion in the second quarter. Its previous estimate was for a profit of 20 cents a share and sales of $8.6 billion.

In a note to investors, analyst Sumit Dhanda said he expects continued market share gains across all microprocessor segments. Dhanda cited Semiconductor Industry Association data, which he said showed well-above seasonal trends for processor shipments in the June quarter.

Dhanda kept his “buy” rating on the stock.

He believes NOR flash sales of Intel, which is scheduled to report its earnings on July 17, improved from a depressed base in the first quarter. Desktop processor sales also appear to have staged a strong rebound, he added.

The analyst believes business momentum has improved across the sector. While demand uncertainties remain, key cyclical indicators -- like channel inventory and utilization trends -- are favorable, he said.

“Stock prices also enjoying a tailwind from aggressive buyback programs,” he added. (Reporting by Shamik Paul, Bhaswati Mukhopadhyay in Bangalore)
header: UPDATE 1-RESEARCH ALERT-BofA ups Intel estimates, price target
